snippet: How an electric car company, a Homeland Security official and Hillary Rodham Clinton’s brother figure in to Terry McAuliffe’s campaign for governor.
abstract: Electric car company GreenTech Automotive, backed by Virginia gubernatorial  candidate Terry McAuliffe, close adviser to both former President Bill Clinton and his wife Hillary Rodham Clinton, has become an explosive issue in the race with concerns of fraud and national security; polls show candidates are neck-and-neck in the increasingly nasty race, and analysts predict the winner will be whichever candidate is getting less negative press on Election Day.

byline.contributor: Amy Chozick and Jim Motavalli contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: How an electric car company, a Homeland Security official and Hillary Rodham Clinton’s brother figure in to Terry McAuliffe’s campaign for governor.

headline.main: Hopeful’s Connections Jolt Bitter Virginia Race
headline.print_headline: Hopeful’s Connections Jolt Bitter Virginia Race
